required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Glycemic and Metabolic Responses of Frozen Yogurt Containing Saskatoon Berry Powder in Healthy Males and Females
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Study to Examine the Glycemic and Metabolic Responses of Frozen Yogurt Containing Saskatoon Berry Powder in Healthy Males and Females

brief_summary.textblock: A single site, blinded, randomized, controlled study designed to examine the glycemic and metabolic response of frozen yogurt containing Saskatoon berry powder in healthy males and females.

detailed_description.textblock: A single site, blinded, randomized, controlled study designed to examine the glycemic and metabolic response of frozen yogurt containing Saskatoon berry powder in healthy males and females. Eligible participants will be asked to attend 4 in-person clinic visits for comparative testing of the frozen yogurt and frozen yogurt containing Saskatoon berry powder versus white bread. Separate visits for screening and for a fasting blood sample will also be requested (total of 6 visits).

primary_outcome.description: glucometer readings of serum glucose at intervals after consumption of study foods

secondary_outcome.description: serum insulin levels in response to consumption of study foods
mass spectrometry analysis of serum and urine before and after consumption of study foods

arm_group.description: unflavoured frozen yogurt - 25 g available carbohydrate
frozen yogurt containing powder prepared from Saskatoon berries - 25 g available carbohydrate

intervention.description: Frozen yogurt containing a defined amount of powder prepared from Saskatoon berries (serving size = 25 g available carbohydrate)
Unflavoured frozen yogurt (serving size = 25 g available carbohydrate)
White bread (serving size = 25 g available carbohydrate)
White bread (serving size = 25 g available carbohydrate)

overall_official.affiliation: St. Boniface Hospital, Asper Clinical Research Institute

facility.name: St. Boniface Hospital, Asper Clinical Research Institute
